_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary:

Brakebush Wells, located at 115 N Broadway, Wells MN is a poultry processing facility. Anhydrous ammonia is used as a refrigerant at this facility for processing and to provide cooling for storage rooms. Our refrigeration system is a closed loop system with normal operating pressures that range from 15" of vacuum on the low side to a high side pressure of 210psi in our south engine room identified as ER1. While normal operations range from 10psi on the low side to a high side pressure of 210 psi in our north engine room identified as ER2. The maximum amount of ammonia in the system at any one time is estimated at 12,928 pounds.

Alternative Release Scenario for a toxic substance:

Accidental Release and Emergency Response Policies:

Brakebush Wells has established an in house emergency response team to quickly respond to and handle the release of anhydrous ammonia. The established steps include initial training under OSHA Regulation 20 DFR 1910.120 HAZWOPER. The facility has also established annual refresher training for all personnel that are on the Hazmat team as well as periodic spill drills and plant wide evacuation drills to assure all personnel are prepared in the event of an emergency. These established plans and procedures are periodically reviewed to ensure that they are current and up to date.



Emergency Response Program:

Brakebush Wells has trained selected personnel, including refrigeration operators in Hazardous Waste Operation and Emergency Response, OSHA's 29 CFR 1910.120. The trained personnel will assess each release situation and determine the appropriate level of response to initiate. This could be by dimply tightening a flange bolt or packing gland, or initiating a system shut down. Brakebush Wells has established written operating procedures for the ammonia refrigeration system and has included in those procedures the emergency shut down and isolation in the event of a

release. Brakebush Wells has also purchased HAZMAT equipment consisting of; cartridge type gas masks with ammonia cartridges, face shields, safety glasses, and rubber gloves. The hazmat team has been trained in the Incident Command Structure system.



Five year accident history:

There have been no reportable releases in the last 5 years.



General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:

Brakebush Wells has not only complied with the EPA Risk Management Program but also OSHA Process Safety Management regulations to ensure that the ammonia refrigeration system is well maintained and the employees are properly trained and periodically retrained to ensure that they are kept up to date on any changes and new operations that may affect them. In addition, to maintain the mechanical integrity and safety of this process, this facility practices the following industry codes and standard:



ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Codes

ANSI B31.3 Piping Code

IIAR Industry Guideline for Safety and Good Engineering Practices

NFPA Guidelines for Fire Protection Equipment



Through regular audits, training, maintenance, testing and inspection programs Brakebush Wells has established a history of safe operation and that training is done for a safe and timely response in the event of an accidental release.
